titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُصُّ الْخَاتَمَ وَ الْحَصَاةَ وَ النَّوَاةَ
titles.en: Chapter 36 – Regarding the man who sucks the ring, and the pebble, and the date stone

titles.ar: بَابُ الشَّيْخِ وَ الْعَجُوزِ يَضْعُفَانِ عَنِ الصَّوْمِ
titles.en: Chapter 37 – The old man and the old woman who are weakened from the Fasting

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَزْدَرِدُ نُخَامَتَهُ وَ يَدْخُلُ حَلْقَهُ الذُّبَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 35 – Regarding the Fasting-one who swallows his mucus and the fly enters into his throat

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الرَّجُلِ يَمُصُّ الْخَاتَمَ وَ الْحَصَاةَ وَ النَّوَاةَ
titles.en: Chapter 36 – Regarding the man who sucks the ring, and the pebble, and the date stone

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/300)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَعْطَشُ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَعْطَشُ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ قَالَ

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Abdullah Bin Sinan,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding the man who gets thirsty in the Month of Ramaan. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem if he were to suck the ring’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa’id from al-Nadr ibn Suwayd from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about a man who becomes thirsty in the month of Ramadan. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful if he sucks his signet.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/300)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ مُحَسِّنِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ الْخَاتَمُ فِي فَمِ الصَّائِمِ لَيْسَ بِهِ بَأْسٌ فَأَمَّا النَّوَاةُ فَلَا .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hassan, from Muhassan Bin Ahmad, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The ring in the mouth of the Fasting one, is not with a problem. But, as for the date-stone, so no’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad from has narrated from Ali ibn al-Husayn from Muhsin ibn Ahmad from Yunus ibn Ya’qub who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, say, ‘The presence of a signet in the mouth of a fasting person is not harmful, but a date-stone is.’”
